segment.source: Audit Mode Overview
segment.target: Audit Mode Overview

segment.source: Audit Mode Overview
segment.target: Audit Mode Overview

segment.source: Audit Mode Overview
segment.target: Audit Mode Overview

segment.source: When Windows boots, it starts in either Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE) mode or in audit mode.
segment.target: When Windows boots, it starts in either Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE) mode or in audit mode.

segment.source: OOBE is the default out-of-box experience that allows end users to enter their account information, select language, accept the Microsoft Terms of Service, and set up networking.
segment.target: OOBE is the default out-of-box experience that allows end users to enter their account information, select language, accept the Microsoft Terms of Service, and set up networking.

segment.source: You can configure Windows to boot to audit mode instead.
segment.target: You can configure Windows to boot to audit mode instead.

segment.source: In audit mode, you can make additional changes to the Windows installation before you send the computer to a customer or capture the image for reuse in your organization.
segment.target: In audit mode, you can make additional changes to the Windows installation before you send the computer to a customer or capture the image for reuse in your organization.

segment.source: For example, you can install drivers included in a driver package, install applications, or make other updates that require the Windows installation to be running.
segment.target: For example, you can install drivers included in a driver package, install applications, or make other updates that require the Windows installation to be running.

segment.source: When you use an answer file, Windows processes settings in the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.
segment.target: When you use an answer file, Windows processes settings in the auditSystem and auditUser configuration passes.

segment.source: When you boot to audit mode, you log into the system using the built-in administrator account.
segment.target: When you boot to audit mode, you log into the system using the built-in administrator account.

segment.source: After you log on to the system, the built-in administrator account is immediately disabled during the auditUser configuration pass.
segment.target: After you log on to the system, the built-in administrator account is immediately disabled during the auditUser configuration pass.

segment.source: The next time that the computer reboots, the built-in administrator account remains disabled.
segment.target: The next time that the computer reboots, the built-in administrator account remains disabled.

segment.source: For more information, see Enable and Disable the Built-in Administrator Account.
segment.target: For more information, see Enable and Disable the Built-in Administrator Account.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are in audit mode and a password-protected screen saver starts, you cannot log back on to the system.
segment.target: If you are in audit mode and a password-protected screen saver starts, you cannot log back on to the system.

segment.source: The built-in administrator account that was used to log on to audit mode is immediately disabled after logon.
segment.target: The built-in administrator account that was used to log on to audit mode is immediately disabled after logon.

segment.source: To disable the screen saver, either change the power plan through Control Panel or configure and deploy a custom plan.
segment.target: To disable the screen saver, either change the power plan through Control Panel or configure and deploy a custom plan.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a Custom Power Plan.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a Custom Power Plan.

segment.source: Settings in an unattended answer file from the oobeSystem configuration pass do not appear in audit mode.
segment.target: Settings in an unattended answer file from the oobeSystem configuration pass do not appear in audit mode.

segment.source: Benefits of using Audit Mode
segment.target: Benefits of using Audit Mode

segment.source: In audit mode, you can do the following:
segment.target: In audit mode, you can do the following:

segment.source: Bypass OOBE.
segment.target: Bypass OOBE.

segment.source: You can access the desktop as quickly as possible.
segment.target: You can access the desktop as quickly as possible.

segment.source: You do not have to configure default settings such as a user account, location, and time zone.
segment.target: You do not have to configure default settings such as a user account, location, and time zone.

segment.source: Install applications, add device drivers, and run scripts.
segment.target: Install applications, add device drivers, and run scripts.

segment.source: You can connect to a network and access additional installation files and scripts.
segment.target: You can connect to a network and access additional installation files and scripts.

segment.source: You can also install additional language packs and device drivers.
segment.target: You can also install additional language packs and device drivers.

segment.source: For more information, see Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode.
segment.target: For more information, see Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode.

segment.source: Test the validity of a Windows installation.
segment.target: Test the validity of a Windows installation.

segment.source: Before you deploy the system to end users, you can perform tests on the system without creating a user account.
segment.target: Before you deploy the system to end users, you can perform tests on the system without creating a user account.

segment.source: Then you can prepare the system to start in OOBE on the next boot.
segment.target: Then you can prepare the system to start in OOBE on the next boot.

segment.source: Add more customizations to a reference image.
segment.target: Add more customizations to a reference image.

segment.source: This reduces the number of images that you have to manage.
segment.target: This reduces the number of images that you have to manage.

segment.source: For example, you can create a single reference image that contains the basic customizations that you want to apply to all Windows images.
segment.target: For example, you can create a single reference image that contains the basic customizations that you want to apply to all Windows images.

segment.source: You can then boot the reference image to audit mode and make additional changes that are specific to the computer.
segment.target: You can then boot the reference image to audit mode and make additional changes that are specific to the computer.

segment.source: These changes can be customer-requested applications or specific device drivers.
segment.target: These changes can be customer-requested applications or specific device drivers.

segment.source: Boot to Audit Mode
segment.target: Boot to Audit Mode

segment.source: You can boot to audit mode on a new or existing Windows installation.
segment.target: You can boot to audit mode on a new or existing Windows installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.
segment.target: For more information, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.

segment.source: Automatically Display the Windows 8 Desktop
segment.target: Automatically Display the Windows 8 Desktop

segment.source: In some Windows 8 manufacturing or testing scenarios you might need to automatically display the Windows 8 desktop instead of the Windows 8 start screen after the PC reboots.
segment.target: In some Windows 8 manufacturing or testing scenarios you might need to automatically display the Windows 8 desktop instead of the Windows 8 start screen after the PC reboots.

segment.source: This might be required if you use manufacturing tools that display status to a Window on the desktop and you want your factory technicians to easily identify issues without having to manually switch from the Windows 8 start screen to the desktop.
segment.target: This might be required if you use manufacturing tools that display status to a Window on the desktop and you want your factory technicians to easily identify issues without having to manually switch from the Windows 8 start screen to the desktop.

segment.source: You can automatically display the Windows 8 desktop by using %WINDIR%System32oobeAuditShD.exe.
segment.target: You can automatically display the Windows 8 desktop by using %WINDIR%System32oobeAuditShD.exe.

segment.source: AuditShD.exe must be run by an account with administrator permissions.
segment.target: AuditShD.exe must be run by an account with administrator permissions.

segment.source: We recommend adding this command-line to your answer file as a RunAsynchronousCommand in the auditUser configuration pass.
segment.target: We recommend adding this command-line to your answer file as a RunAsynchronousCommand in the auditUser configuration pass.

segment.source: Use Windows System Image Manager to add Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentRunAsynchronousRunAsynchronousCommand with the value %WINDIR%System32oobeAuditShD.exe.
segment.target: Use Windows System Image Manager to add Microsoft-Windows-DeploymentRunAsynchronousRunAsynchronousCommand with the value %WINDIR%System32oobeAuditShD.exe.

segment.source: The answer file you create will look similar to the following:
segment.target: The answer file you create will look similar to the following:

segment.source: Before a Windows 8 PC is shipped to a customer, Windows must be configured to boot to the OOBE screens and display the Start screen on first boot.
segment.target: Before a Windows 8 PC is shipped to a customer, Windows must be configured to boot to the OOBE screens and display the Start screen on first boot.

segment.source: Verify that AuditShD.exe is only configured to run in audit mode and is not used during OOBE.
segment.target: Verify that AuditShD.exe is only configured to run in audit mode and is not used during OOBE.
